description:
Hi,

we're about to use OpenStack more and more in production, and when finally fully migrated, we'll have 50+ compute nodes, however, one thing we are really really missing is some "description" field/column in the list of existing instances.

This might also require a new database field, ideally, I know, and yet, this is a really demanding feature, requested by our devs (who are actually the users of  the cloud) :-)

I also think that might be a great addition and helpful to more people, too.

Regards,
Christian Parpart.

p.s.: please tell me if this is NOT the proper way to raise feature requests.
title: [feature] description field in instance list

comments.content:
Hey Christian, there is no support for that currently, although you can give the instances "names".  As a work around, you could give them unique names that are more descriptive.  

However, as a feature request, I would suggest you change the "affects project" to Nova, since it would need to be supported there before we could expose the data in Horizon.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~devcamcar

comments.content: I hope I did it right. :-)

comments.content: This is a reasonably request, but it's been about 9  months without anyone working on it.  I'm going to move it into "Opinion / Wishlist" which is a queue of older requests.  This can be reopened later if someone is interested in working on it.  Thanks!
